meanings.definition: To rule or govern as an absolute monarch.
meanings.sent1: The king would enarch over his kingdom with complete control.
meanings.sent2: She enarched over the land, making all decisions without question.
meanings.sent3: The cat enarched over the house, deciding when it was time to eat.
meanings.sent4: The sun enarched the sky, casting its bright light over the world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher enarched the classroom, guiding the students with authority.

meanings.definition: A ruler or governor with absolute power.
meanings.sent1: The enarch of the country made all the laws.
meanings.sent2: The enarch was feared by all for his strict rule.
meanings.sent3: The enarch of the playground decided the game everyone would play.
meanings.sent4: The enarch of the forest, the mighty oak tree, stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent5: The enarch of the kitchen, the chef, prepared delicious meals for the guests.

meanings.definition: The act of ruling with absolute authority.
meanings.sent1: His enarch over the company was unquestioned.
meanings.sent2: The enarch of the household ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The enarch of the garden, the scarecrow, kept the birds away from the crops.
meanings.sent4: The enarch of the road, the traffic light, controlled the flow of cars.
meanings.sent5: The enarch of the library, the librarian, maintained order among the books.
